thread.title: Game Essentials: Whitecaps fail to score, draw with Dallas
thread.title_full: Game Essentials: Whitecaps fail to score, draw with Dallas

title: Game Essentials: Whitecaps fail to score, draw with Dallas
text:
Game Essentials: Whitecaps fail to score, draw with Dallas By Gary Kingston, Vancouver Sun October 7, 2015 11:33 PM Vancouver Whitecaps head coach Carl Robinson walks onto the field for an MLS soccer game against the Seattle Sounders in Vancouver, B.C., on Saturday September 19, 2015. Photograph by: DARRYL DYCK , THE CANADIAN PRESS 
THE SKINNYSo much on the line, so much anticipation. And we get big fat doughnuts on the scoreboard, a 0-0 draw. Sure the Caps clinched a playoff berth with the single point — their third time in the post-season in five seasons — but they are stumbling to the finish line of the regular season. Vancouver is winless in four and 2-4-2 over their last eight. And the goal scoring has gone AWOL. They missed some glorious chances Wednesday and have to thank goalkeeper David Ousted for the single point. He made two terrific second-half saves. Dallas striker Blaz Perez also just missed on a shot to the far post in the 90th minute. 
SAY WHAT?Veteran centre back Pa-Modou Kah knows eight languages, including English and Danish. But he and Ousted, the big man from Denmark, failed to communicate twice as Kah was making back passes and it nearly cost the Caps. On the first one, with Kah under pressure, he surprised Ousted with a hard, short pass that the ’keeper had to kick into touch. On the second, Kah’s back pass sailed past a scrambling Ousted and out for a corner. 
CAN WE PLAY 5-A-SIDE?
